snippet: A new report takes several countries to task for not following through on promises to research the background of art that may have been looted from Jews during World War II.
abstract: Conference on Jewish Material Claims Against Germany and the World Jewish Restitution Organization release report evaluating conduct of nearly 50 countries that pledged greater efforts to return artwork bought or confiscated from Jews during the 1930s and 1940s; countries cited for lackluster efforts include Italy, Hungary, Poland, Argentina, Spain and Russia.
lead_paragraph: A new report takes several countries to task for not following through on promises to research the background of art that may have been looted from Jews during World War II.

headline.main: Nations Called Lax in Returning Art Looted From Jews
headline.print_headline: Report Criticizes Lax Efforts on the Restitution of Wartime Looted Art

keywords.value: Conference on Jewish Material Claims Against Germany
keywords.name: organizations
